sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The avifile package contains aviplay, avibench, avifile-config, mmxnow-config, avirecompress, avicap, avirec, kv4lsetup, avicat, avitype and avimake.

sect3.title: aviplay
sect3.para: aviplay manages the input formats, the codecs and the output formats to display AVI video files on your screen.

sect3.title: avibench
sect3.para: avibench performs a measurement of the avifile library's performance for a file.

sect3.title: avifile-config
sect3.para: avifile-config is run by configure for programs wishing to link to the avifile library.

sect3.title: mmxnow-config
sect3.para: mmxnow-config is run by configure for programs wishing to link to the mmxnow library.

sect3.title: avirecompress
sect3.para: avirecompress is a widget that takes an input file of one codec type and converts it into a video file of another codec.

sect3.title: avicap
sect3.para: avicap is a widget that displays acquired video fro a Video For Windows (vfw) compatible device, like a webcam or a TV-tuner.

sect3.title: avirec
sect3.para: avirec is a command line video recording tool.

sect3.title: kv4lsetup
sect3.para: kv4lsetup is a small tool which tells video4linux about the current video mode

sect3.title: avicat
sect3.para: avicat takes a set of AVI files and combines them into a single file.

sect3.title: avitype
sect3.para: avitype will read and display AVI file header information.

sect3.title: avimake
sect3.para: avimake takes a set of JPG images and creates a movie.
